byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik reported from Dhaka, and David Barstow from New Delhi.
byline.original: By JULFIKAR ALI MANIK and DAVID BARSTOW

abstract: Islamic State says it shot and killed Italian aid worker Cesare Tavella in Dhaka, Bangladesh; if confirmed, attack would be first by ISIS in country.
lead_paragraph: If the claim is verified, the killing of Cesare Tavella, 50, would be the Islamic State’s first attack in Bangladesh.

headline.main: ISIS Says It Killed Italian Aid Worker in Bangladesh
headline.print_headline: ISIS Says It Killed Italian Aid Worker in Bangladesh

snippet: If the claim is verified, the killing of Cesare Tavella, 50, would be the Islamic State’s first attack in Bangladesh.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
